title: Find Ratios of Consecutive Terms
text: To determine if a sequence is geometric, we find the ratio of the consecutive terms shown.

title: Ratio Between $$8$$ and $$4$$
text: What is the common ratio between $$8$$ and 4? Effectively, what is $$\frac{4}{8}$$?

title: Ratio Between $$4$$ and $$2$$
text: What is the common ratio between $$4$$ and 2? Effectively, what is $$\frac{2}{4}$$?

title: Ratio Between $$2$$ and $$1$$
text: What is the common ratio between $$2$$ and 1? Effectively, what is $$\frac{1}{2}$$?

title: Ratio Between $$1$$ and $$\frac{1}{2}$$
text: What is the common ratio between $$1$$ and $$\frac{1}{2}$$? Effectively, what is $$\frac{\frac{1}{2}}{1}$$?

title: Ratio Between $$\frac{1}{2}$$ and $$\frac{1}{4}$$
text: What is the common ratio between $$\frac{1}{2}$$ and $$\frac{1}{4}$$? Effectively, what is $$\frac{\frac{1}{4}}{\frac{1}{2}}$$?

hintAnswer: Yes, the series is geometric. The common ratio is $$r=\frac{1}{2}$$.
title: Determining Commonality in Ratios
text: Are the ratios between consecutive terms common?
choices: Yes, the series is geometric. The common ratio is $$r=2$$.
Yes, the series is geometric. The common ratio is $$r=\frac{1}{2}$$.
Yes, the series is geometric. The common ratio is $$r=\frac{1}{4}$$.
No, the series is not geometric.
